defs.docs: billboard

attributes.value: / The `billboard` crate provides a convenient, high-level API
/ for creating billboards in the terminal.

defs.name: BorderComponents
defs.value: BorderComponents { top_left, horizontal, top_right, vertical, bottom_right, bottom_left }
defs.docs:
`BorderComponents` defines the `String`s to use when dislaying
 the corners and sides of a `Billboard`.

attributes.value: / `BorderComponents` defines the `String`s to use when dislaying
/ the corners and sides of a `Billboard`.

defs.name: top_left
defs.docs: `String` to display as the top left corner of a `Billboard` border.

attributes.value: / `String` to display as the top left corner of a `Billboard` border.
/ This should be one visual character wide.

defs.name: horizontal
defs.docs: `String` to repeat as the top and bottom of a `Billboard` border.

attributes.value: / `String` to repeat as the top and bottom of a `Billboard` border.

defs.name: top_right
defs.docs: `String` to display as the top right corner of a `Billboard` border.

attributes.value: / `String` to display as the top right corner of a `Billboard` border.
/ This should be one visual character wide.

defs.name: vertical
defs.docs: `String` to repeat as the left and right of a `Billboard` border.

attributes.value: / `String` to repeat as the left and right of a `Billboard` border.

defs.name: bottom_right
defs.docs: `String` to display as the bottom right corner of a `Billboard` border.

attributes.value: / `String` to display as the bottom right corner of a `Billboard` border.
/ This should be one visual character wide.

defs.docs: `String` to display as the bottom left corner of a `Billboard` border.

attributes.value: / `String` to display as the bottom left corner of a `Billboard` border.

defs.name: Custom
defs.docs: Border with custom `BorderComponents`.

defs.name: BorderStyle
defs.value:
enum BorderStyle {
    Single,
    Double,
    Round,
    Bold,
    SingleDouble,
    DoubleSingle,
    Classic,
    Custom(BorderComponents),
}
defs.docs: Different styles for the border of a `Billboard`.

attributes.value: / Different styles for the border of a `Billboard`.

defs.name: Config
defs.docs:
`Config` holds the configuration of a `Billboard`
 and determines how it should be displayed

attributes.value: / and determines how it should be displayed

defs.name: default
defs.docs: The default `Config` is a centered box with centered text

attributes.value: / The default `Config` is a centered box with centered text

defs.name: padding
defs.value: fn padding<'a>(&'a mut Self, usize) -> &'a mut Config
defs.docs:
Set the padding of your `Billboard` to a specific size
 This is the space around the text inside of your `Billboard`

attributes.value: / Set the padding of your `Billboard` to a specific size

Get a `Billboard` from a `Config`

defs.name: Billboard
defs.docs:
`Billboard` is a customizable data structure that will pretty print content
 separated by newlines (`\n`).

attributes.value: / `Billboard` is a customizable data structure that will pretty print content

defs.name: config
defs.docs:
Display configuration of the `Billboard`. This field dictates how a `Billboard` will
 be displayed in the terminal.

attributes.value: / Display configuration of the `Billboard`. This field dictates how a `Billboard` will

defs.docs: Creates a new `Billboard` from a pre-made `Config`.

attributes.value: / Creates a new `Billboard` from a pre-made `Config`.

defs.name: builder
defs.docs: Get a configuration builder to customize the appearance of a `Billboard`.

defs.name: display
defs.docs:
Prints your `Billboard`ed content to `stdout`
 If your content is long, separate it with line breaks (`\n`).

attributes.value: / If your content is long, separate it with line breaks (`\n`).
/ If the user's terminal is too small, or something goes wrong with displaying
/ your content in a box, this function will print the content passed to it
/ If you would like to handle specific error cases, it is recommended to use
/ Billboard::default().display("Hello, World!\nNew lines can be created with the newline separator :).");

defs.name: as_str
defs.docs: Get your content in a `Billboard` as a `String`.

attributes.value: / Get your content in a `Billboard` as a `String`.
